description: From Middle English doleful, doolful, deolful, equivalent to dole +â€Ž -ful.

adjectives.description: doleful (comparative more doleful or dolefuller or dolefuler, superlative most doleful or dolefullest or dolefulest)

entries.meaning: Filled with grief, mournful, bringing feelings of sadness.
examples: The doleful peal of the bell indicated another funeral was being held.
